docs.snippet: The Hudson River steamer Newburg of the Homer Ramsdell Line narrowly escaped being burned last night, and the hundred or so passengers and crew who started on board her for the trip to Newburg from this city had ample occasion to thank their lucky...
docs.lead_paragraph: The Hudson River steamer Newburg of the Homer Ramsdell Line narrowly escaped being burned last night, and the hundred or so passengers and crew who started on board her for the trip to Newburg from this city had ample occasion to thank their lucky stars that they got off without loss of life.

headline.main: FLAMES ON A STEAMBOAT; THE NARROW ESCAPE OF THE PROPELLER NEWBURG. HER PASSENGERS AND CREW ESCAPED BUT IT TOOK TWO HOURS TO PUT OUT THE FIRE IN THE CABIN.

docs.snippet: ASBURY PARK, N.J., Nov. 27.--The Germania, a three-masted schooner, went ashore at Long Branch opposite the West End Hotel to-night. She was discovered at 6:15, and word was immediately taken to the Elberon Life-Saving Station, which is a distance...
docs.abstract: Germania Stranded at Long Branch; Eleven Lives Lost; Coroner's Verdict
docs.lead_paragraph: ASBURY PARK, N.J., Nov. 27.--The Germania, a three-masted schooner, went ashore at Long Branch opposite the West End Hotel to-night. She was discovered at 6:15, and word was immediately taken to the Elberon Life-Saving Station, which is a distance of only a quarter of a mile from the scene of the wreck.

headline.main: ELEVEN LIVES WERE LOST; BIGGEST WRECK IN YEARS ON THE JERSEY COAST. THE SCHOONER GERMANIA FROM BREMEN GOES DOWN WITH MOST OF HER CREW--A COAL BARGE FOUNDERS.

docs.snippet: The Mallory steamship Leona, which arrived yesterday from Galveston, brought the crew of the three-masted schooner Furman L. Mulford, which foundered at sea on Nov. 17 in latitude 30 10' and longitude 79 30'....

headline.main: RESCUED BY THE LEONA.; EIGHT SHIPWRECKED SEAMEN PICKED UP IN THE NICK OF TIME.

headline.main: RESCUED NONE TOO 'SOON.; SHOWING THE FOLLY OF GOING TO SEA IN AN EIGHTEEN-FOOTER.

headline.main: A STEAMER CUT DOWN.; HER CARGO OF PIG IRON AND EIGHT OF HER CREW LOST.

docs.snippet: BURLINGTOM, Iowa, April 19.--The steamer Everett, a raft boat belonging to the Burlington Lumber Company, was sunk at the head of Otter Island last night and five of the sixteen persons on board were drowned....
docs.lead_paragraph: BURLINGTOM, Iowa, April 19.--The steamer Everett, a raft boat belonging to the Burlington Lumber Company, was sunk at the head of Otter Island last night and five of the sixteen persons on board were drowned.

docs.snippet: As the Albany night boat Drew of the People's Line was coming down the Hudson about 2 o'clock yesterday morning she collided just below Kingston with the sloop Revenue, Capt. James M. Collyer, of Athens. The sloop filled and sank almost immediatel...
docs.abstract: Revenue Sunk by Collision with Drew
docs.lead_paragraph: As the Albany night boat Drew of the People's Line was coming down the Hudson about 2 o'clock yesterday morning she collided just below Kingston with the sloop Revenue, Capt. James M. Collyer, of Athens. The sloop filled and sank almost immediately, only the top of the mast remaining above water.

headline.main: SUNK IN THE HUDSON.; THE REVENUE COLLIDES WITH THE DREW AND GOES TO THE BOTTOM.

docs.snippet: The steamer Richmond of the Old Dominion Line returned to port yesterday with a much damaged larboard side. She had in tow the coal-laden schooner Jacob Reed, with which she had been in collision off Barnegat Thursday night....
docs.lead_paragraph: The steamer Richmond of the Old Dominion Line returned to port yesterday with a much damaged larboard side. She had in tow the coal-laden schooner Jacob Reed, with which she had been in collision off Barnegat Thursday night.

headline.main: COLLISION WITH A SCHOONER.; ACCIDENT TO THE STEAMER RICHMOND OFF BARNEGAT.

docs.abstract: Atlas Wreck in North River; Danger to Navigation
docs.lead_paragraph: Lying in about 50 feet of water, 800 feet off the north slip of the Hoboken Ferry Company at the foot of Barclay-street, is the wreck of the steamship Atlas, which waa sunk by the ferryboat Central of the Central Railroad of New-Jersey about three mouths ago.

headline.main: IT IS A DANGEROUS WRECK.; BUT THE ATLAS IS ALLOYED TO REMAIN WHERE SHE WAS SUNK.
